title: 110_hr5906
content: The Act titled "Small Business Capitol Expansion and Improvement Act of 2008" allows for expensing certain real property under section 179F. The taxpayer can elect to treat the cost of qualified real property as an expense not chargeable to capital account, with a limit of $125,000 for the deduction in the taxable year. This amount is subject to inflation adjustments for taxable years after 2009. The taxpayer can elect to treat the cost of qualified real property as an expense not chargeable to capital account, with a limit of $125,000 for the deduction in the taxable year. The election must be made on the taxpayer's tax return and is irrevocable without the Secretary's consent. Qualified real property refers to section 1250 property located in the United States, meeting specific criteria. The taxpayer must meet a $5,000,000 gross receipts test for the prior taxable year to be described in this subsection. The test requires the average annual gross receipts for the 3-taxable-year period to not exceed $5,000,000. Aggregation rules apply for persons treated as a single employer. The taxpayer must meet a $5,000,000 gross receipts test for the prior taxable year. If the taxpayer was not in existence for the entire 3-year period, special rules apply. No deduction is allowed unless a report is filed with the Secretary. Conforming amendments include allowing deductions for expenditures under section 179F. The taxpayer must meet a $5,000,000 gross receipts test for the prior taxable year. Special rules apply if the taxpayer was not in existence for the entire 3-year period. A report must be filed with the Secretary for deductions under section 179F. Amendments allow deductions for expenditures under section 179F. Section 312(k)(3)(B) is amended to include section 179F. Section 179F allows for the election to expense certain real property. The amendments made by this section apply to costs paid or incurred after the enactment of this Act.
